newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador opposition rejects OAS intervention.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador opposition rejects OAS intervention.

text.p: Ecuadoran opposition congressmen and unions on Wednesday spoke out against President Abdala Bucaram's call for intervention by the Organisation of American States (OAS) in the crisis facing the government.

"The intervention of the OAS is necessary in problems concerning sovereignty, but not in internal ones such as these," Heinz Moeller, an opposition Social Christian Party member of Congress, told reporters.
"The OAS should not intervene in this case," said Cesar Verduga, an opposition Social Democrat Congress member.

OAS Secretary General Cesar Gaviria flew to Ecuador on Wednesday to help solve the crisis leading to a 48-hour general strike that started Wednesday. It was called by trade unions protesting against government austerity measures and demanding Bucaram's resignation.
Union leaders threatened to prevent Gaviria from landing in the country.
"We are going to take the installations at the airport to prevent Cesar Gaviria from getting out of the airplane," Stalin Vargas, president of the country's teachers union, told reporters.
